column4: Anyone had any experiences with odd behavior upon trying to install a new card?
I put a wireless card into my system, and the system wouldn't start up properly.
what's improper about it?
It would boot (with no errors during the boot process) and bring me to the login screen, but once I logged in, it wouldn't bring up the desktop.
freaky.  cant help
i have wmp54gs....
Have any issues installing?
sudo apt-get install bcm43xx-fwcutter
lemme see what its chipset is
Mine's version 4.1, I believe they used different chipsets for different versions.
do an lspci and see what vendor/product numbers it gives
thatd tell me which of these http://linux-wless.passys.nl/query_part.php?brandname=Linksys it is
It's the Ralink set, looks like.
oh
right....

did you try hotplugging it by any chance? it sounds stupid to do, but ive heard of some cards that wont work if they're a generic version of another card when you boot, but putting it so its almost in then snapping it in after boot then fudging with numbers so it looks valid works
Hrm, I've not heard of that, but I can give it a try.
the one i read about was on a laptop where the manufacturer of the laptop made a card that was the same but had different numbers on lspci that made it freak out if you used the generic one
Just rather odd, there's a ton of documentation/discussion on this card with Ubuntu, and none of it mentions a thing like this.
probably a bad card
That'd be my luck, too.
